abstract.p: von Dawans, Bernadette, Fischbacher, Urs, Kirschbaum, Clemens, Fehr, Ernst, & Heinrichs, Markus. (2012). The Social Dimension of Stress Reactivity: Acute Stress Increases Prosocial Behavior in Humans. Psychological Science, 23(6), 651–660. (Original 10.1177/0956797611431576)

body.p: Figure 2c in this article included incorrect data points. A corrected figure is shown below.

caption.p: Participants’ (a) mean level of subjective stress, (b) mean level of free salivary cortisol, and (c) heart rate during the experimental session. Results are shown separately for the stress and control conditions. Time 0 was the start of the Trier Social Stress Test for Groups (TSST-G; von Dawans, Kirschbaum, & Heinrichs, 2011). Error bars indicate standard errors of the mean.
